title: Tombstoning
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'OK, I've got a few hours spare while Amy's at a friend's birthday party, so how about if you meet me outside the Museum of Scotland on Chambers Street at two o'clock. How does that sound?'

title: The Dead Beat
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Really? She'd seen a cassette player like his, a yellow version instead of red, on a school trip to the Museum of Scotland round the corner. A fucking museum.

title: World: round it and over it ... letters ... With illustrations ... Second edition
author: Glass, Chester.
snippet: The courtbefore the sanctuary was the chief object of interest here. On either side were a number of chambers, in which themodes of celestial (?) punishment are placed before thepublic eye—reminding me somewhat of the ghastly relicsin the Black Museum of Scotland Yard. In one of the

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The Tower Restaurant was above the new part of the National Museum of Scotland. As a boy, Bruce had been taken to the museum on several occasions, on school trips from Crieff, and had enjoyed pressing the buttons of the machines kept on display in great, ancient cases.
